Title: Protected by the Shelter of the Most High

Verses.1:
Whoever lives in the shelter of the Most High,
	will find rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
Verses.2:
I will say of the LORD, "My refuge and my fortress,
	my God, my trust is in Him."
Verses.3:
For it is He who rescues you from the fowlers snare,
	and from the deadly plague.
Verses.4:
He will cover you with His feathers,
	and under His wings you will take refuge,
	His faithfulness is a shield and wall.
Verses.5: You will not fear the terror by night, or the arrow that flies by day,
Verses.6:
or the plague that stalks in darkness,
	or the destruction that strikes at noon.
Verses.7:
A thousand will fall at your side,
	and ten thousand at your right hand,
	but you will stay out of reach.
Verses.8:
You will only look with your eyes,
	and watch as the wicked are punished.
Verses.9:
For you have made the LORD, my refuge,
	the most high, your fortress.
Verses.10:
No evil will touch you,
	nor plague approach your tent.
Verses.11:
For He will give His angels orders concerning you,
	to protect you in all your ways.
Verses.12:
On their hands they will carry you,
	so you never strike your foot against a stone.
Verses.13:
On the lion and cobra you will tread,
	and trample the young lion and the dragon.
Verses.14:
"Since they have loved Me, I will rescue them.
	I will protect them, because they have known My name.
Verses.16:
With a long life I will satisfy them,
	and I will show them My salvation."

Changes: 2021-09-02 - Paul Prins: Removed Liturgical Formatting from the version in the breviary.
